ygData.subject: Re: crawling progress problem
ygData.msgSnippet: Aha!  So that s what was wrong.  30 retries of 15 minutes each is a long, long time to wait.  Now I know what to modify in the crawl order file.  Thanks much

Aha!  So that's what was wrong.  30 retries of 15 minutes each is a
long, l=
ong time to wait.  Now I know what to modify in the crawl order
file.  Than=
ks much for your help!

--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, Igor Ranito=
vic <igor@...> wrote:
>
> Hello,
> 
>
https://intel.taleo.net/servlets/art.=
product.careersection.identityprovider.login.LoginController
> is really ta=
king a long time to 'error out' with 503. Looking at the
the 
> crawl.log y=
ou can see that it took 4 attempts to get 503.
> It is possible that we tim=
ed out first three times. Take a look at the 
> local errors log. You will =
probably see -2 codes for this URL.
> These timeouts in combination with of=
 dynamic politeness and retry
delay 
> (default 15 minutes) probably accoun=
ts for the idle time of 45 minutes.
> 
> The second idle period is related =
to 
>
https://intel.taleo.net/servlets/art.product.careersection.identitypr=
ovider.register.RegisterController
> It timed out 30 times and finally the =
crawler gave up and moving to the 
> next URI. Now, 30 retries of 15 minute=
s is about 7.5 hours. The second 
> delay was only about 5.5 hours. So, it =
seems that you did change retry 
> delay and that it worked. Again take a l=
ook at the local errors log. 
> Search for the URL and see timestamps of ea=
ch retry.
> 
> I hope that I got the math right.
> 
> Take care,
> i.
> 
> =

> blah_1977 wrote:
> > Hi all,

site that I'm crawling.  I let

ly finished crawling 101 pages
> > in just under 8 hours.  Below is a porti=
on of the crawl

 there's an

e

g
> > "retry-delay-seconds" in BdbFrontier, as well as "timeout-seconds" in=
